website_summaries.verdict: This pastry cutter evenly blends even frozen butter into your dough; however, it's most comfortable for smaller hands.
pros: Sturdy and durable with thick rubber handle
Easily blends in even frozen butter
cons: The handle is a bit small for comfortable use

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent Dough Blender
customer_reviews.text: Quality Kitchen Aid. I made the best pie crust of my life yesterday using this dough blender and Mrs Anderson's Baking Non-Stick Pastry Cloth Frame to roll out the dough. I cannot say enough about this dough cutter. It fit my hand beautifully and worked easily to blend the frozen butter and flour. I will never use my food processor again to make pie dough. This blender is all I need.
customer_reviews.author: AnneTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool...
customer_reviews.text: I've used the pastry cutter for about 60 days and really liked the solid feel and heft. The tings on other blenders tend to bend becaued they are made from thinner steel, and the connection between the handle and blade of the "best seller" broke after using it for less than a year. One thing I would like to see is a little larger handle. While the cutter works well, I have larger hands than most women and many men and I have to put one finger outside the handle. Maybe offer the cutter in small and large? Besides that one down-side, this is a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: A Pipkin

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Gem
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality of this great little blender. It is well made, does the job beautifully, goes in the dishwasher and ready to use again. It seemed a little small when I opened the box, but my hand fit comfortably around it to use it. (I wear a ladies size large glove) It works well in a large or small bowl. In fact, because it is smaller, it is easier to store in my small kitchen. I wouldn't hesitate to order from this seller again. I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Choosy Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Top small, handle too short
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 5'5" female with average size hands. The handle isn't even the width of my palm. There's nothing 'comfort' about the grip either. It's just a non slip handle. I can see it becoming painful with the edges of the handle digging into my palm with frequent use so I'm returning.
customer_reviews.author: Kit kat

customer_reviews.title: Feels well made and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I recently started making scones and needed a better way to integrate the butter into the flour than using my hands. This dough blender did the trick just great! It is easy to use and does a good job on cutting the butter into the dry ingredients in a more even manner than using my hands. I have seen many comments on the blender being small. It was definitely smaller than I thought it would be, but it works perfect for me. I don't think I have exceptionally small hands, but it fits my hand fine and is easy to work with. If you have a larger hand, I would consider going up to the next size Spring Chef offers.
customer_reviews.author: tkmomhal

customer_reviews.title: Made in China and Half Finished
customer_reviews.text: Made in China, of course. The bottom tines are not machined smoothly; so the side edges are razor sharp. If you put your finger on the bottom, it's fine. But if you touch it at the slightest angle, you can slice yourself. Hardly an engineering gem. I guess machining the edges would have cut into the profits by a few cents. It should be sold with some bandaids.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my mom. She couldn't find one during this pandemic. I got on my account and purchased it for her. She really loves it! She really liked the handle, she said that it was comfortable for her to use and she said the blades were really strong and sturdy. My dad used it next to make tortillas and he said he didn't have to put much effort into cutting the flour with the butter because the blades were really strong. My parents are in their 70's very active and love to cook and bake. I was pleased that this product worked so well for them!
customer_reviews.author: queeny378

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this a few days and was excited because of all the reviews for this brand. I used it for the first time to make pie dough tonight and was highly disappointed that one of the outside blades bent and that was able to bend it back by pushing it gently with my finger. Not truly heavy duty. I do like the screw to connect the handle to the blades though.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Fine for minimal use
customer_reviews.text: The handle moves slightly so you have to hold the handle and the side so it doesn’t just spin in your hands. Works well otherwise. If I used this more often then I would have returned it because of the handle problem, but I only use this a handful of times a year. Size is smaller than I realized.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea L. Empey

customer_reviews.title: Runs a bit small but works great
customer_reviews.text: It just fits my 3 3/4" wide palm with zero wiggle room so while it's not uncomfortable, it's not the kind of thing I can grab without looking. But it does exactly what it's supposed to do. I'm new to making pie crusts but when I switched from using two butter knives for cutting shortening into flour to this pastry cutter, I experienced an immediate improvement to the uniformity of my crusts. If it fits your hand, I can't imagine you'll regret the purchase. But as I said, I'm a complete beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Chromatic8

customer_reviews.title: This is the best pastry cutter I’ve ever used!
customer_reviews.text: This pastry cutter is stainless steel. The handle is padded and fits the hand quite well. The best thing about this particular pastry cutter is the fact that the blades are kind of “sharp”, so to speak. When you touch the blades, they actually feel a bit sharp! When I used it to make biscuits a couple of days later, it cut through the butter with ease, and I was able to reach the consistency I was after pretty quickly. It blended the butter and the flour wonderfully. I highly recommend. It’s also pretty easy to clean using a nice, sturdy sponge or washcloth.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell W. Estes

customer_reviews.title: Product has been downsized.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had our old one so long, the handle started turning. Trying to tighten it up didn’t work. That was okay, we paid about $3.00 for it over twenty years ago, and it had been used 2-3 times a week. This one is kind of disappointing. The black handle is about 1/2 inch shorter than the old one was. I’m very tall, my hands are larger than most women’s, and a lot of men’s, so it will probably work for you. After making a pie crust, my index finger was a little roughed up, even though I changed the way I held it.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie’sMom

customer_reviews.title: Screw connecting blade to handle comes loose
customer_reviews.text: The screw that connects the blade to the handle comes loose and the blade spins around the handle and slides up your hand in a painful/uncomfortable way. Tried tightening it but it just undoes itself. Returning item and will replace with something that has a better connection.
customer_reviews.author: kt

customer_reviews.title: Every baker needs one
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who bakes needs this tool in their baking drawer. When it arrived I was impressed with the design and workmanship of the dough blender. The impression was confirmed when I used it. I was making lemon squares and the crust has to be baked before filling it with the lemon mixture. It was very much faster way to cut the butter into the flour mixture and the results were much more consistent. My taste tester said the results were far better than my previous lemon squares. I was also impressed with the tips on using it that were emailed and cleanup of it was as easy at the tip said. Thanks for a great baking tool.
customer_reviews.author: GolfBob

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, difficult to hold and unsafe
customer_reviews.text: This items is tiny! My hand barely fit to the handle and I need to be careful how I hold it because the side metal is very sharp and not smooth, and I’m afraid it will cut my hand If I press on it hard. I do not recommend this because it is not ergonomic and unsafe.
customer_reviews.author: K&Z

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Dough Blender
customer_reviews.text: I have my grandmother's dough blender which I use a lot, but I wanted an extra because I use my blender for other things as well as dough. This one is very sturdy and I love the handle. It's comfortable and easy. I have used my new one to chop hard-boiled eggs, mix up tuna and chicken salad, mash potatoes and make guacamole - so many uses. This dough blender is really good quality and good price - I am very happy and pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Roush

customer_reviews.title: small hand hold
customer_reviews.text: The item is sturdy enough but fitting your hand on this item is nearly impossible. The hand hold is really small and I have small hands. The black handle is hard and narrow and it makes it difficult to work with. I don't get all the good reviews this item is not that great.
customer_reviews.author: greenqueenpreen

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: If you don't mind taking a file to the edges then this is worth getting. It is very sturdy and is stamped out of thick stainless. The stamping process leaves very sharp edges however, which might be expected by the lower cost. Bead tumbling would solve this but would add some cost of course. Handle is small in width which I expected but it could be deeper as your fist will get into the cookie dough. Still, it works well and will probably last forever. I just put it in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Salli & GeneTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: This blender makes a quick job of cutting shortening into flour!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this dough blender after struggling for years trying to cut shortening into dough for biscuits, crust, and the like with knives and forks, etc. My new dough blender did a speedy job of my last batch of dough, coming together in seconds rather than ten or more minutes. It is very efficient and easy to clean! I highly recommend this dough blender!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Look for a better item
customer_reviews.text: Blades are crudely stamped metal with sharp burrs all around. These edges get packed with dough, making clean up difficult. Handle is quite small, forcing my fingers against the sharp burrs In addition to all that, the actual "cutting" edges are very blunt.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product, the handle width is slightly too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: The product is made from thicker metal than my previous cutter/blender that I have had for years. That is the reason I purchased it. I was not disappointed in the quality of the cutter/blender. However the size of the handle is a little too small for my hand. At only three inches it compresses my hand which is very uncomfortable for me. I was planning on replacing my old cutter/blender, which the handle is just shy of four inches, with this one. But, I think I will keep my old one and give this one to one of my daughters.
customer_reviews.author: Urban Fantasy Fan

customer_reviews.title: metal burs on blades
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product to anyone. 10-18-2020. I opened the package and the stainless steel blades had metal bur shavings sticking out from the blades. This product is not food safe and I would not use it to make food from my family due to the dangerous metal shavings. I wrote to the company and waiting reply. Will not recommend this product or name brand. I will be looking into the same product but through pamper chef because i know they take great pride in there products. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Multi use kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and durable! I use for mashing potatoes, works better than a standard masher. Cuts through butter easily for pastry dough. Purchased the large size and glad I did because I can fit my whole hand around the handle. Blades are sharp enough for almost any type of task that requires mashing or blending of solid ingredients. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: chitown64

customer_reviews.title: dough blender
customer_reviews.text: the dough blender is just as it was described on Amazon. I have only had it a few weeks, but have really enjoyed using it. It is a handy helper and blends your food well, no over blending. It is easy to hold and easy to clean. Since I have only had this a couple of weeks I cannot speak for it's durability, even though it seems very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: babear9

customer_reviews.title: Super nice pastry cutter
customer_reviews.text: Who knew pastry cutters were so hard to find?? Spring Chef's is super nice- blades are sturdy, handle is comfortable, and it gets the job done. i've used the "2 knife" method of cutting butter into flour with less than optimal success, as well as food processor- another thing to clean! this pastry cutter is very well made and i look forward to using it for years!
customer_reviews.author: jtinthesouth

customer_reviews.title: Best one I could find on Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased this as a gift- I am comparing it to my pastry cutter. While not the same, my hope is that this one will hold up as well. The tines are just as strong as mine, the only worry I have is the handle. I had a cutter that had a bolted on handle and it did not last long. Crossing my fingers here. The handle is very comfy though.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Re

customer_reviews.title: Feels solid, But
customer_reviews.text: I have had a great SS wire pastry cutter for many years but the screws kept coming loose. I bought this thinking it would be better. It feels sturdy, however it is heavy and the handle is on the small side The inside of the metal edges on the cutting blades are quite jagged and sharp. Be careful wile cleaning by hand. I may have to try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would have given this 5 stars, but...
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4, for one issue, which is easily fixed. The edges of the metal sides were sharp and would probably cut your hands. I was prepared for this, since I saw another review mentioning the problem. The simple fix: I took an emery board and smoothed all the metal edges. (You could use sandpaper instead.) It's now a great product. It is sturdy and much better than the 2 dough blenders I inherited from my mom.
customer_reviews.author: N. White

customer_reviews.title: Great for Children!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, if I had of read further I would have seen them show the handle is only 3 inches wide. And that's on the outside! I measured the inside width, the part where you grip, and came up with 2 and 3/4 inches, barely enough for three of my fingers. I won't be returning it because it is my fault for not reading through the full page. But I won't be using it either.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Marquis Aurele

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy dough blender
customer_reviews.text: I use this to blend pie dough ingredients, and it works great. It's solidly built, sturdy, the blades don't bend, and I love that I can clean it in the dishwasher. I dreaded replacing the old dough blender that was handed down to me by my grandparents because new ones seem so flimsy; I bought new ones twice and they wore out and bent and I went back to my old one, even though the handle was coming apart. I'm so glad to finally find a worthy replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Be careful in ordering the right size
customer_reviews.text: The picture let me to believe the dough blender was larger and I did not notice that there were two sizes offered. So the default size I received was the smaller blender which is not comfortable if you have large hands. Works fine and I will not return it as it was my mistake. But altogether it is a good product. But if you have large hands, be sure to buy the larger one...well worth the extra $.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Small. Ideal for a kid.
customer_reviews.text: This would be perfect for someone with a small hand, or a child learning how to cook. This will not fit an adult hand without painfully hitting your hand. The blade radius is very small.
customer_reviews.author: gr8tchr4u

customer_reviews.title: Simple, well built....But
customer_reviews.text: I liked the construction of this unit...but I found that the stamping process used to cut the metal left a sharp shear edge on one side of each of the cutters. It wasn't going to make this a slicer...but made it harder to clean the edges. I spent some time with a sharpening stone to remove the edges and bevel each side. A lot easier to clean and works like it should. If they would have burnished the stamping before they assembled them..It would be a Top shelf kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: very durable, but handle has a tendency to move.
customer_reviews.text: Still using this thing over two years later. I use it at least once a week and haven't had any real issues. The handle does spin on me from time to time depending on how frozen my ingredients are, it causes my hand to scrape against the metal side, which doesnt feel very good, but its just something I've gotten used to.
customer_reviews.author: Joel & Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, solidly built, good-quality metal.
customer_reviews.text: Have used it a few times since I got it, for making guacamole and egg salad (I'm not much of a baker). It held up really well. Solid construction, but as others have noted, the handle may be a little narrow for big-handed folks (I'm a full-grown man and it's fine). Threw it in the dishwasher every time and it came out like new, no stains from the avocados even though it day on the counter overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Norm L.

customer_reviews.title: Pastry must have
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use. Works better for making pastry dough instead of a fork. It easily mashes the butter and is sharp enough for what is needed. Very easy to handle and it is built very sturdy. Only downside is that it is a pain to clean up. Using a sponge rips the sponge up and soaking it takes way too long.
customer_reviews.author: MoStyle

customer_reviews.title: The dough blender has a great grip. My hands hurt a lot
customer_reviews.text: The dough blender has a great grip. My hands hurt a lot, but I was craving scones that don't suck and that's not so easy on Long Island. Italian bakery, sure. Scones? Not so much. Same with clotted cream; which is a revelation, along with raspberry jam, on a really good scone. I was able to use the blender to cut cold butter into the dry ingredients. I thought I'd need my husband to help, as I often do; instead it was comfortable, worked efficiently, and made me DELICIOUS scones. And yes, I got clotted cream delivered from Tea & Sympathy. It was scrumptious.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Cocozzello

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this five stars except for one small problem. The side pieces on mine we're kind of sharp. To the point that it would have cut me if I did take a little sand paper and run it over the edges. Once I did that everything was fine and I'm okay with that. I just wish quality control would have taken care of that coming off the factory line. But I like it and it is well made.
customer_reviews.author: tackless

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We had somehow misplaced our dough blender/pastry cutter and had the darnedest time finding a replace locally. Found this product with awesome reviews and decided to give it a try. We couldn't be happier! The blades are sharp and handle sturdy where it doesn't slip out of my hands. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Maui Dammie

customer_reviews.title: Best pastry blender to date
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several pastry blenders...some are too big, some of the the handles are too hard...some of the blades were too flimsy...you get the idea. I LOVE this pastry blender. The handle is comfortable and easy for my smallish hands to grip (no more cramped hands). It is super sturdy. I have owned it for a week and have already used it twice.
customer_reviews.author: D. Shomon

customer_reviews.title: Spring Chef Dough Blender with sharp edges.
customer_reviews.text: The one I received had not been finished off right. Edges are very sharp and dangerous. Had to take sand paper to round the edges off to avoid getting cut. Now it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Sohmers

customer_reviews.title: be careful handling
customer_reviews.text: very strong and sturdy. edges are very sharp and dangerous. had to take a file and round all edges to make it safe to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes the job so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: The dough blender is a great tool for baking that makes it so much easier to cut butter into the mixture for biscuits, scones and, I assume, any other type of batter use for baking. I used to use a knife to do the job which was somewhat dangerous and more time consuming. I would highly recommend this very sturdy and sharp dough blender to any baker, whether you be a beginner or not.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne N.

customer_reviews.title: Great pastry cutter, but handle may be a little small for some.
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I have with this pastry cutter is that the handle is too small for my hand. I see that it the one I bought is described as (Black-Medium) so perhaps there is a larger model that I didn't notice when I bought this one. Other than that, I'm very happy with it. It is very sturdy and because it uses 'blades' instead of wires I don't have to constantly clear butter from it while I'm using it.
customer_reviews.author: Fleetboat

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: I started baking again during the stay at home order, and have been watching old episodes of The French Chef on Amazon Prime. Julia suggested one of these and it made a huge difference in my tart crust. I would definitely recommend to anybody that wants to make a fluffy pastry dough.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher5Top Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: The handle spins causing the metal sides to scrape against the sides of your knuckles. Really wish I would have returned it! Dough also is pretty hard to clean off the side screws.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Salley

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: This product is too small. The handle fits only 3 of my fingers, and I'm a small person. I'll give it away.
customer_reviews.author: T. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed. I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I made my first pie crust with this. I loved it. I have had others that I used for making biscuits and they fell apart. This held up, and fit my hands perfectly. I have seen others post about the handle being too narrow. I did not find this to be the case, and I have large hands. I will be putting this to good use through the holidays!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Moon

customer_reviews.title: They still do make them like they used to
customer_reviews.text: My mother gave me her dough blender back in the 80s. She bought it when she first moved to the U.S. in the early 50s, and I loved that thing. Sadly, the handle broke after 60 years of use, and I was unable to find one that felt right after that. Either the blades were too thin, or too wide apart, or the blades had a little too much "give" when I pressed down on it. This dough blender is exactly like my mother's. It feels just right when I use it, and my pie crusts are beautiful and flaky now to an extent that was lacking previously. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Baptist

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Scones
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to help cut the cold butter in the dough. Tired of using a food processor, cleaning up, or using two forks to break up the butter in the dough. This product gives you more control and it doesn’t take long. It is also dishwasher safe and I use it alot!
customer_reviews.author: Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Now, I'm a Pastry Chef!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how easy this dough blender is to use and how easy it makes baking. Frankly, I'm a pretty good cook but according to my family, this tool has upped my game! It is sturdy, is easily held and used and blends beautifully. Holiday cooking and baking will be a breeze this year. Up your baking game with this dough blender!
customer_reviews.author: Diane N

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PASTRY CUTTER
customer_reviews.text: I was a little sceptical about purchasing a pastry cutter for $9.97, but let me tell you that this is one of the best pastry cutters I've ever used! The pastry cutter that I was using before was made by Pampered Chef but the quality difference was evident. The Pampered Chef cutter feels cheap in my hand, where as this one fella strong and durable. I highly recommend this pastry cutter!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Holak

customer_reviews.title: Really great for making biscuits
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur baker, but I wanted something to cut butter into flour, and this is great for that. It's a little hard to clean by hand, I don't have a dishwasher. But that's not the fault of the product. It's just the nature of this design. If you have a dishwasher, then really, cleaning should be a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica E Bowers

customer_reviews.title: excellent dough cutter
customer_reviews.text: I RECEIVED THIS THE OTHER DAY ,JUST IN TIME FOR BAKING AN APPLE /PECAN PIE FOR THE JEWISH HOLIDAY. I HAD NEVER USED ONE BEFORE BUT LOOKED AT MANY CHOICES ON AMAZON AND THING I CHOSE THE PERFECT ONE FOR ME. SIZE, EASE OF USE AND TO CLEAN. MADE MY JOB THAT MUCH EASIER DEFINITELY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: lynnie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap metal is sharp and hurts your hand, spend a few $ for something better
customer_reviews.text: This is cheap stamped chinesium which really hurts your hand due to sharp edges. I wish I had bought something better.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered this for my daughter. However, when it arrived, I was so impressed with the heftiness of it compared to the one I’d been using for years (which had a bent time) that I decided to keep it for myself. And after using it on some boiled eggs I was really impressed and ordered another one for my daughter. I’m sure she is going to be very happy with it too. ( my old one is now at a garage sale)
customer_reviews.author: Sparky Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: It has been a year since I purchased this and am finally getting around to review it. I love it. I hadn't realized that I had a cutter when I ordered this (it was buried in a drawer). But compared to this one it is worthless. I have used it to make hundreds of biscuits and it is still like new! It is sturdy and strong. It cleans up beautifui!. Would highly recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie.

customer_reviews.title: This is a sturdy, well made blender, easy to use, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: The Spring Chef Dough Blender was a gift for my teenage grandson. Being healthy at home during the Covid 19 social distancing, he has extra time on his hands. I’m helping him hone his cooking skills. This week we’re going to learn the fine art of pastry making. The dough blender is the perfect tool to cut the shortening into the flour.
customer_reviews.author: Suze

customer_reviews.title: Quality, but not for larger hands.
customer_reviews.text: Ireally like this dough blender. Cuts cold butter with flour amazingly well, and does not clog up. I would have given 5 stars if the handle were just a half inch longer. If you have larger hands, it works well but my index finger sits uncomfortably against the blade. If I had to cut larger batches, I would probably get quite uncomfotable. Great value for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my older one had broken. What I'm going to like about this is that the "blades" are not welded on, but seem to be molded from one continuous piece. I use it not only for pastry, but mashing avocados and blending creamy dips. Fabulous tool.
customer_reviews.author: MEJ

customer_reviews.title: She’s so versatile.
customer_reviews.text: She beautifully cut the sugar and flour into semi firm butter for the lemon bar crust, she can also be used to mash potatoes, avocados and many others. Easy to wash. Comfortable handle. Price is great. Easy to store. Quick delivery. She’s a versatile kitchen gadget, a must have if you don't own a mixer like me.
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This fits perfectly in my hand, so I don’t quite get the comments on that issue unless you have big hands. I’m a normal sized woman with normal sized hands and I love it! Perfect for blending in the butter for my sweet potato casserole as well as crushing the pecans. Will be great for when I get a craving for deviled eggs, too. It’s also dishwasher proof, so no muss, no fuss. A winner!
customer_reviews.author: High 5

customer_reviews.title: Safer alternative to the wire-based cutters
customer_reviews.text: We previously had a wire-based cutter that worked well, however, one of the wires suddenly popped out of the handle and posed a very dangerous situation (especially when children are around helping)! We decided to give this solid metal version a try and so far it works well. The only complaint would be that the width isn't quite as wide as I like, but it's probably fine for most purposes. Extending the cutting section up the sides toward the handle would also be desirable, but not at the expense of safety.
customer_reviews.author: sake77kuma

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with multi-functions!
customer_reviews.text: I love this to use mixing sugar and butter to make pastries, and cakes and pies, in addition to mixing other food items! I even use it to mash eggs! This is very easy to clean and easy to hold!! I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jmd

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I bake a lot of biscuits and scones so this is perfect for cutting in the cold butter to the dry ingredients. It fits my hand perfectly so I can really get that butter mixed in. It’s strong and sturdy and gets the job done. I highly recommend this if you are a baker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bake almost daily and this is my Goto tool
customer_reviews.text: This Dough blender is the best I could buy. I like that a mans hand can fit it, but not too heavy for a Jr chef either. blades are sharp, but not too sharp. as all Dough blades, they are a pain to clean, but hit it with some pressurized water and toss it in the dishwasher. I bet this will last for 30 years.
customer_reviews.author: lovetoshoot

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but small handle and poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I was disappointed in this item, and will return it. Pro: Although I didn't use it, out of the box it feels very sturdy. Con: However, the handle is very small(too small) and uncomfortable; previous reviews mentioning the small handle didnt concern me bc I'm petite, but its more for a child's hand size. Also, the blades were very rough, with unsmoothed metal that could scratch my dishwear, and definitely tear apart any cleaning sponge/scrubbie with each wash, adding the good possibility to cut my hands as well. I'll look further for better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Christick44

customer_reviews.title: Small but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I use the product to make biscuits. My hands are small and I have arthritis in my fingers so this smaller size is just right for me. Despite its smaller size, the sturdiness of the product makes it possible to do the same job .
customer_reviews.author: D Hoffie

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The blades seem sturdy, but the medium-sized handle was quite small. The large one is more like a standard size that you'd get from OXO or other brands alike. However, this dough blender has the most sturdy blades compared to the other ones I've owned. Also, the customer service was impressive so I'm updating my review to support a small business!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki N.

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product particularly for making buttermilk biscuits, although I’m sure it’ll come in handy for other things as well. This is a very well made product & well worth the money. I’d definitely buy it again under the same circumstances. It’s a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen tool EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had used one of these at my son's house and fell in love with it. Now that I have my own I am in heaven. I am making Alice Water's shortcakes during this strawberry and peach season and sneaking them for breakfast. This implement is well made; has just the right amount of sharpness to cut that butter into tiny pieces in no time. At 82 yoa and a cook all my life I sure am happy I discovered this before I left the planet!
customer_reviews.author: Seaworthy

customer_reviews.title: Really blends well!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Dough Blender is great!!!! I don’t even have a mixer, so this is going to be my go to tool for baking. I made the crust for lemon bars using the Dough Blender even though the recipe called for a mixer. It came out fabulous. I was most impressed that after I ordered this item from Amazon I got an email from the owner with tips on using it. The Dough Blender is sturdy and easy to use. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: HE

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little tool for cutting butter into dry ingredients. The medium size fits a small hand well. No more sore wrists and fingers. Not sure if that’s really a good thing, as I’m now more willing to make buttery desserts and biscuits.🤣
customer_reviews.author: Nan V.

customer_reviews.title: Not a good design, but is sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I wish the metal strands went all the way to the handle. Dough gets easily caught in the tines that are not separated, so you are constantly scraping off the dough. My mother had one like that, but I couldn’t find another. Not a good substitute.
customer_reviews.author: JustJNL

customer_reviews.title: Easy to bend tines
customer_reviews.text: The steel is soft and bends, especially cutting in cold butter. I just straighten them and align them but it should have be made of a steel that is more like a spring. I am going to keep it just because I do not have any thing else to do this.
customer_reviews.author: Alpine TX

customer_reviews.title: Good and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I really like how this item is made - it's a good sturdy utensil, the metal goes all the way up so you don't have the plastic 'dog ears' that a lot of Dough blender's have that get broken relatively quickly, which is why I purchased this item. It worked well with making biscuits and I'm hoping to get many, many years of use out of this product. If anything needs to be updated, I'll visit again and update!
customer_reviews.author: B. White

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool to have
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tool to have. I never owned one, and am glad that I do now. This particular model is very sturdy and well made. It is also easy to clean. Haven't used it to make a pie dough yet, (That's this weekend). But have used it to make egg salad. Much more efficient than using a fork. I am sure it will be just as efficient with dough.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P. G. Hammill Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: The dough blender did a good job of cutting in the butter when I was making my pie crust. Easy to use and was able to finish the job quickly. Just a tad small for my hand, but I can live with that. Cleans well, is sturdy and meets my need.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Kellar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend!! I used my new dough blender today and it was fantastic! It works beautifully and enabled me to make a delicious pie crust easily. I've owned other dough blenders in the past and they've never worked well or lasted very long. Thank you for creating a great product!
customer_reviews.author: KWVT

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done but the handle is pretty uncomfortable. The edge kept cutting into my palm ...
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done but the handle is pretty uncomfortable. The edge kept cutting into my palm while mixing, making for a sore hand after I was done.
customer_reviews.author: blondie7700

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy, comfortable grip, and overall one of the handiest things to have in your kitchen. Made scones last night and it saved me like 12 years since I normally would just use a couple forks to cut the butter in
customer_reviews.author: Nicki

customer_reviews.title: Spring Chef Dough Blender
customer_reviews.text: This is the best dough blender I have ever seen. I have another brand and this one is far better made and the metal this company uses with not bend like the other one I have. Made very well. Would recommend to anyone that like to cook.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy B. Yeich

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with the quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love this pastry blender! It is sturdier and at a better price than any I could find in my local stores. The handle is small, but I don’t have large hands, so it fits perfectlyVery satisfied with this pastry blender. It’s sturdy and easy to hold. Much better quality than what I found in my local stores.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Joy

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had purchased long ago!
customer_reviews.text: I should have made this purchase long ago. I used to use a fork to mix butter into my dry ingredients. This makes it so much easier and actually does the job. Quality product and a great value. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Skydivingellen

customer_reviews.title: Love this little guy
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy. Easy to use. Works well. I'm old school. I like using my hands vs a machine. I find it therapeutic. So far I've used this to make the crust for lemon bars and for shortbread. Great addition to my kitchen gadget collection.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Suszczynski

customer_reviews.title: My go to weapon in the kitchen!!
customer_reviews.text: This damn thing is sharp!! I didn’t realize it because I’m an idiot and I of course had to find out the hard way....I’m not sure how it works on dough but it slices...it dices....and it juliennes.
customer_reviews.author: Sar

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I have one of these before
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! Yesterday I used it to blend together cranberry sauce and a French dressing. I was using a spoon, but the cranberries just wouldn't cooperate. Then I remembered this pastry cutter. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Reid

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleased with the quality
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I was very pleased with the quality. Also, having osteoarthritis in my hands, I was surprised & pleased by the handle grip and how quickly I was able to blend the pastry. A pdf was attached & very helpful. One of our family’s favorite pies is fresh pear with a toasted hazelnut crumb topping. Chopping the hazelnuts has always been a challenge. I never thought of using a pastry blender but am looking forward to using it to chop nuts! This past week (pre-Thanksgiving) I have only used this pastry blender several times. I am very pleased and know it will last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Elrod

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I had apprehensions about this purchase as I had bought another, much more expensive, version of this pastry cutter years ago and it was very difficult to clean. This one is great. Its well made and very easy to clean. I bought it for my boat and that's a pretty good test for things that purport to be "stainless" . This product is holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: John Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Only if you’re an elf
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made and sturdy but I am a smallish woman and it hurts my hand to hold it and apply the pressure necessary to cut in butter (I wear a small-medium in dish gloves). I can’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this unit, based on a friend's recommendation. It's waaaaay better than the dough blender I've had for the last 35+ years...the difference in construction between a Yugo and an M1 Battle tank.
customer_reviews.author: Henry W.

customer_reviews.title: IDEAL DOUGH BLENDER FOR HOME USE
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE A SMALL KITCHEN WITH LIMITED STORAGE SPACE AND THIS DOUGH BLENDER IS SIZED SMALL ENOUGH FOR STORAGE, BUT LARGE ENOUGH FOR ALL OF MY DOUGH BLENDING REQUIREMENTS. ADDITIONALLY IT IS EASY TO CLEAN AND STRONG ENOUGH FOR ANY ANTICIPATED FUTURE DOUGH BLENDING.
customer_reviews.author: NO NAME

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, just smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: High quality, heavy duty construction. The size is listed as “medium” but it’s slightly smaller than I anticipated. I would say the “large” is likely closer to an average size. This one is good for smaller hands.
customer_reviews.author: Deedub

customer_reviews.title: Need to blend stuff quickly and easily? Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a pastry blender for a buttermilk biscuit recipe I wanted to make. Amazon recommended this one. It was a great suggestion. Easy to hold and mix dough even with fibromyalgia pained hands. Bit hard to clean since it's sort of bladed.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Averello

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy: Biscuit Butter Cutter
customer_reviews.text: You have to use your strength! (Elbow Grease) for chopping cold butter into flour to created the best Biscuits in town. It does not bend very sturdy! Beware: don’t touch the blade with fingers Other than that Great product
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Well built, sharp but small
customer_reviews.text: This dough cutter is well built and much sharper than our old one. But it is quite small, making it somewhat uncomfortable to us. And we use it often, mostly to blend guacamole'.
customer_reviews.author: Russell L. Henkel

customer_reviews.title: Handy little gadget
customer_reviews.text: The item came exactly as advertised. I will say that I never thought I'd need this little tool, until I was reading a recipe this weekend for something I was making and it specifically called for a "pastry slicer" (which apparently is this little guy). I got by using another tool but can definitely understand why this was called for. Now I have it if needed again.
customer_reviews.author: CMCampbell

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Small defeat
customer_reviews.text: This works as intended. Good quality however there was a little rip like tear on the handle. Doesnt affect the use, just not 100% new. Regardless it's made well apart from that defect that most shouldn't have
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice solid weight and has a comfortable grip. It cuts butter or shortening into flour easily and thoroughly. I dislike chopping eggs for egg salad and this makes it quicker and easier. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Dickens

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and the han del is easy on hand..I use this mostly for pastry but it is sturdy enough for dividing han burger, mashing avacodoes, ect.. I had one other cheaper one before this that fell apart after a few years so I know this Spring Chef model will last a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: Wballen

product_meta.title: Spring Chef Dough Blender, Top Professional Pastry Cutter with Heavy Duty Stainless Steel Blades, Medium Size
feature_bullets: BETTER THAN YOUR GRANDMA'S DOUGH BLENDER - You'll be shocked by the high quality and WANT to bake more just so you can use it, which is ultimately healthier for you and your family. Sturdy and durable with metal blades that are twice as thick as our competitors...Your search is over for one of the greatest kitchen gadgets that you can now pass on to future generations.

WOW THE CROWD WITH IMPRESSIVE RESULTS - Get ready for better texture and taste from all of your baked goods. Make flakier and fluffier biscuits, pie crust, pizza dough, scones, pastries and more. You'll be amazed at how quickly this tool works to get uniform pieces of butter mixed in flour which creates a better, yummier end product.

YOU'LL WONDER HOW YOU EVER MANAGED WITHOUT IT - Heavy duty without being heavy and cuts through cold butter beautifully, making it a must-have tool if you bake. Don't waste time or effort using a fork or potato masher only to get half results.

NO MORE SORE HANDS AND WRISTS - Comfortable soft grip handle that fits small to medium-sized hands perfectly - and it won't make you tired after using it. You can do more without having to worry about hand and wrist fatigue. The thick rubber is much safer than plastic and easy on those with arthritis.
GOOD FOR MORE THAN JUST CUTTING BUTTER - chop fruit and soft vegetables or nuts, mash up baby food, make salsa, guacamole and muffin topping - the options are endless!
